questions.question: What physical quantity is primarily measured in the torsional oscillation experiment?

explanations.a: Frequency is related but not the primary focus.
explanations.b: Correct. Moment of Inertia is the key result measured in the simulation.
explanations.c: Angular displacement is involved but not the main outcome.
explanations.d: Mass is an input, not the measured output.

questions.question: Which parameter can be varied to study the damping effect of different liquids?

explanations.a: String affects restoring torque, not damping.
explanations.b: Object shape affects inertia, not damping medium.
explanations.c: Correct. Medium affects the damping of oscillations.
explanations.d: Amplitude affects motion but not the damping medium.

questions.question: How does increasing the mass of the object affect the moment of inertia in this experiment?

answers.a: It decreases the moment of inertia
answers.b: It increases the moment of inertia
answers.c: It does not change the moment of inertia

explanations.a: Incorrect. Moment of inertia is directly proportional to mass.
explanations.b: Correct. More mass results in a higher moment of inertia.
explanations.c: Incorrect. Mass is a key factor in calculating moment of inertia.
explanations.d: Mass also affects inertia, not just amplitude.

questions.question: Which of the following objects will generally have the highest moment of inertia in torsional oscillation?

explanations.a: Discs have more evenly distributed mass.
explanations.b: Cylinders have moderate moment of inertia.
explanations.c: Correct. Dumbbells typically have higher moment of inertia due to mass concentration at the ends.
explanations.d: Incorrect. Moment of inertia depends on mass distribution.

questions.question: Which control in the simulation allows the user to change the object used in the torsional pendulum?

explanations.a: This changes the surrounding medium, not the object.
explanations.b: This modifies the object's mass, not the type.
explanations.c: Correct. This allows selection between Disc, Cylinder, and Dumbbell.
explanations.d: This changes the string, not the object.

questions.question: Why is it important to vary only one parameter at a time in the simulation?

answers.b: To isolate the effect of that parameter
answers.c: To prevent the system from crashing

explanations.b: Correct. It ensures a clear understanding of the influence of each parameter.
explanations.c: The system is designed to handle changes.
explanations.d: Parameter variation is for analysis, not speed control.
